title: Requires cancellation of classes at state universities on Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur, unless chancellor grants exemption
summary: Provides that no class or any other course of instruction shall be held in any institution within the state or city university on those days of religious observance known as Rosh Hashanah or Yom Kippur provided, however, that the chancellor, in his discretion, may exempt any institution from such observance.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to observance of certain holidays by institutions within the state university and the city university of New York
